text: The Volkswagen Caddy is a van produced by Volkswagen in four generations since 1979. == First generation (1979–1996) == The first generation Caddy was built from 1979 until 1996. It was based on the Volkswagen Golf Mk1. In North America, Volkswagen launched the Volkswagen Rabbit Pickup, it was made from 1978 to 1984. File:1988 Volkswagen Caddy (Type 148) utility (27473741605).jpg|1988 Volkswagen Caddy File:1988 Volkswagen Caddy (Type 148) utility (27473696625).jpg|1988 Volkswagen Caddy rear File:1981 Volkswagen Rabbit Pickup Diesel LX, fR.jpg|1981 Volkswagen Rabbit Pickup File:1981 Volkswagen Rabbit Pickup Diesel LX, rR.jpg|1981 Volkswagen Rabbit Pickup == Second generation (1995–2004) == The second generation was made from 1995 to 2004. Two models were available: a van based on the Volkswagen Polo Mk3, and a pickup truck based on the Škoda Felicia. File:VW Caddy II front 20090329.jpg|Volkswagen Caddy File:VW Caddy II rear 20090329.jpg|Volkswagen Caddy rear File:Reading, Berkshire - England (UK) (11528184644).jpg|Škoda Felicia File:Reading, Berkshire - England (UK) (11528223726).jpg|Škoda Felicia rear == Third generation (2003–2020) == The third generation was built from 2003 to 2020. It is based on the Volkswagen Golf Mk5. In 2004, Volkswagen launched a leisure vehicle called the Caddy Life. In 2010 and 2015, the model was improved at the front and back, It had a new grille, new bonnet, new bumper and new headlamps.
